recommendation: Mask or hash user emails before logging; e.g. replace the local-part with asterisks.

description: US Social Security Numbers in logs
recommendation: Remove SSNs from logs entirely or redact all but the last four digits.
Redact phone numbers or replace them with placeholder tokens before writing to log.
Never log full credit-card numbers; mask all but the last 4 digits or omit entirely.

description: Bearer or OAuth tokens appearing in logs
recommendation: Avoid logging tokens; if absolutely needed, truncate or hash them first.
Do not log full JWTs; log only token identifiers or a hashed summary.

description: Password hash leaks (MD5, SHA, bcrypt, Argon2)
recommendation: Never log password hashes; if required, log only a reference ID without the hash.
Anonymize IPs (e.g., truncate the last octet) or mask before logging to protect user privacy.
Avoid logging user-identifying UUIDs directly; map to pseudonymous IDs if needed.
Do not log full cookie values; log only the cookie name or an anonymized marker.
Catch and handle errors gracefully; log only a high-level error message without stack details.
In production, catch exceptions and log only summary; send full trace to a secure error-tracker.
Handle runtime errors in code and log only sanitized messages without sensitive context.
Log only user ID and timestamp on login; avoid logging raw credentials or headers.
Log only essential signup metadata (user ID/email, status); do not log passwords.
Record only the fact of export (user ID, time, success/failure); never log the payload.
